intro: Wilkiea pubescens, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are oppositely arranged and have a velvety texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters. Wilkiea pubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
